entry.title: Flood Watch issued June 08 at 9:03PM PDT until June 12 at 6:21AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .An atmospheric river arrives on Thursday and continues through the weekend bringing periods of moderate rainfall to the Cascades. In addition, rivers fed by melting snow, from the Cascades and

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 08 at 3:05PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN RISES ON RIVERS AND SMALL STREAMS IN THE CASCADES LATE THIS WEEK INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... An atmospheric river moving through the region will result in periods of moderate rain Thursday night through the weekend. This lead to rises on the Stehekin and Okanogan Rivers, which are already running high, due to spring snow melt.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 08 at 2:22PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAINFALL THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY WITH RISING STREAMS AND RIVERS... Heavy rain is expected over the Cascades Thursday night through early Saturday and then across the Blue Mountains and portions of eastern Oregon and Washington Saturday into Sunday. The heaviest rain looks to occur Thursday night into early Friday

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 1:19PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Washington, including the following county, Kittitas. * WHEN...Until 145 PM PDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
